definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: The hands of the witnesses must be the first in putting him to death, and then the hands of all the people.
sentences.chinese: 見證人要先下手，然後衆民也下手將他治死。

sentences.english: shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel?
sentences.chinese: 今日在以色列中豈可治死人呢。

sentences.english: If a man has sexual relations with an animal, he must be put to death, and you must kill the animal.
sentences.chinese: 人若與獸淫合，總要治死他，也要殺那獸。

sentences.english: Your hand must be the first in putting him to death, and then the hands of all the people.
sentences.chinese: 你先下手，然後衆民也下手，將他治死。

sentences.english: Put to death everything in us that does not honor you.
sentences.chinese: 也求禰治死我們身上一切不能叫禰得榮耀的部分。

definition: to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
